website_summaries.verdict: This exceedingly popular document tube offers users phenomenal features for document protection.
pros: Tube is 3.5 inches in diameter with expansion capabilities ranging up to 40 inches
Clear cap showcases ID card for easy identification
cons: A few customers complain that the length-adjustment feature can produce creases on documents

customer_reviews.title: Interlocking prongs are too loose, posters ended up on the floor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tube to carry three fabric posters that are 40 inches wide. It has a clean look, and with an adjustable length how could I have said no at that price... The tubes size adjustment occurs at three interlocking prongs which sounds like a great idea, if they were not too loose. The thing kept coming apart and dropped my posters on the floor too many times. I ended up taping it at the seam to prevent it from unlocking. Yes it may look cool, but has shoddy construction, and I’d say buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: The Doc

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great fishing Rod case
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a case to protect my fishing rods during travel, but most of the products being sold for that purpose were higher in price, so I thought I'd try this document tube. While it isn't durable like a PVC pipe might be, it is adequate for my purposes. In contrast to some of the negative reviews, so far I'm seeing a good positive locking of the adjustability design, and the shoulder strap is ample. I took 2 different densities of foam and cuts discs to press into the base, and a smaller diameter foam duo (so it would fit inside the tube) to glue into the cap, so both ends are well protected.
customer_reviews.author: Cochise

customer_reviews.title: I use it for carting maps back and forth from ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it for carting maps back and forth from D&D sessions. You can fit quite a bit in there, and it keeps everything safe. When you unscrew the cap though, the inner sleeve will sometimes rotate and unlock, which means that the tube extends suddenly if you're holding it in the air. I wish that didn't happen, but it's something that you can get used to after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Darian Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Simple poster tube that works
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable holder for posters or documents. Nothing to fancy here as the material is simply plastic. Fits up to 40 inches as stated using a telescoping mechanism that has notches to lock it in place. The top has a cap with paper insert so you can write your information on it. The poster tube could have been better by making the shoulder strap move along the tube, having the locking mechanism more tight, and making it so the tube doesn't separate after the 40 inch length.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Great product & great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tube for my husband who is an avid concert goer - he likes to buy the show posters to commemorate the event but hates holding/keeping track of it the rest of the night. The first concert he took this to he had multiple compliments on the tube and even had offers from people who wanted to pay him to hold their posters for them and ship it to them later, ha! This product worked perfectly for him; the tube keeping the poster safe and the strap keeping him worry and hands free. Customer service support was very helpful & prompt!
customer_reviews.author: S. Landis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for professional use and/or for storage
customer_reviews.text: I like these poster tubes. I have used one for years for conference posters, and traveling nationally and internationally my presentations have been well protected. Recently, I bought two of these to store my childhood memories. I think the lock feature could be a little better, but I never had any damage to my posters.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy (updated)
customer_reviews.text: The plastic at which the strap attaches to the body broke with very light use. You get what you pay for: if you're going for cheap, buy one of those cardboard tubes and duct-tape some rope to it. Updated: After writing the review, the seller sent me a replacement, which was awfully nice. I suppose I can add that the shell itself is fairly sturdy and should protect your poster pretty well. The locking mechanism was a bit testy: perhaps a quick fix is to just set the right height, then duct-tape the tube in place, using the screw-top to remove / insert your poster.
customer_reviews.author: Kikaimon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material, Strap Broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transport my paper for a drawing class in school. I only use this tube twice a week, it's been 2 months and one of the rings snapped so now I can't use the strap. All in all, it's made of inexpensive materials so I'm guessing this is a tube made to transport a document once or twice and isn't really made to be sturdy in the long term. However, I'm happy that it's extendable, it was waterproof when I got rained on, and it has a strap when most other tubes on Amazon don't. For $25 though (which isn't even the full retail price) I was expecting it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Roonney Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a poster I was taking to get signed at a comic con, the height adjustment randomly pops over sliding up or down, the inside has a small lip that catches the paper(kind of a big deal with a few hundred dollars worth of autographs), and the top where the label is cracked when trying to remove the cover to fill in the label, definitely going with a different type next time.
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but has a couple issues...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as intended and is sturdy casing, and overall is nice. Cons: 1. The lock part of the tube which adjusts the size gets undone every now and then, so its annoying to get that fixed again and again 2. The strap is pretty cheap and already broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.author: Hulk12Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the good, I like the single cap design with a contents description on top, the different color options are great, and I appreciate the arm strap and its ability to expand if needed. On the flip side I expected the tube radius to be bigger than what it was, also the tube is not as sturdy as I perceived it to be on the advertisement. Don't get me wrong it does have some durability but I feel my old cardboard tubes might hold up better if put in a pinch. It's a decent product I would value between $10-15
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and I like that it is adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This is super useful when I bring posters to conferences. I love that it is adjustable so it fits whatever size I'm carrying. The handle is great, and the plastic is sturdy so it doesn't get crushed under luggage. The size is a bit difficult sometimes when going through x-ray machines - one time it got caught inside the machine and someone had to go in and get it out. But that isn't a feature of this product, just of poster holders in general.
customer_reviews.author: C. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't lock in longer positions
customer_reviews.text: Does not lock in place! If all you need is to have this tube at it's shortest length it would be great....but, if you need it longer it just won't stay locked in the longer position so that it doesn't damage your poster. I wanted to look professional at a conference I was attending, however, I looked rather lame with my poster tube taped at the right length so it wouldn't damage my hard work and expensive poster.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great for airplane travel as it is super light
customer_reviews.text: I know this product is aimed at the art enthusiast, however I must say, all you fishing folk out there who travel take a look. Most Rod Tubes were too narrow or too wide and big. This one fit the bill. I was able to put the rods in the tube and over the shoulder it went. Great for airplane travel as it is super light. Each rod was a two piece 6’6” (connected). I was able to fit both rods in fully extended tube. So if you’re a fisherman, and you need a tube for travel fishing, here is a great option. I was so happy I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Solow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service & good quality tube for travel
customer_reviews.text: I use the Nozlen tube to transport flip charts for presentations. The tube has performed well in my national travels. However, I carry the tube on planes rather than checking it. While the tube is well-made, I don't think it could withstand the rigors of the checked luggage process. The Nozlen customer service is also excellent. The first tube I purchased had a strong, unbearable petrochemical smell–a combination of oil and funky plastic. Nozlen quickly sent me a replacement when I notified them of the issue. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: CSH

customer_reviews.title: Does ok but not as checked luggage
customer_reviews.text: There are many things to like with this poster tube. It protects posters and is extendable to work for many sizes of posters. But, it is not super sturdy for air travel. I had to check this tube and came out of baggage handling crushed. Need to use one for work but only use as carry on.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use tube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tube as a rod carrier for my Fennwick spinning rod. I wanted something durable, protective and similar to my fly rod tubes. For the money, this did the trick well. I did wrap my rod in a pack towel before placing it in this tube. I also rode my motorcycle over 1500 miles with this tube and it gave me no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent poster- wish it was a little longer for scientific posters
customer_reviews.text: The poster tube (biggest plus is the blue color) is decent quality. It will hold 40" snugly; I managed to squeeze in a 40" by moving the top portion of the tube above the locking position and moving the strap up. The strap isn't super adjustable to wear across the chest and is a bit awkward if you're female. The locking mechanism is simply plastic indentations like a zipper that you slide up or down to adjust size- it's not as secure as other poster tubes I've used. I hope Nozlen will make one that holds one up to 42" as that's standard size for scientific conferences.
customer_reviews.author: Circe

customer_reviews.title: Saves my posters from getting torn and crumbled!
customer_reviews.text: I have more posters than wall space in my apartment, so I can't display my collection all at once. This tube extends to fit most posters, so I could fit all the ones I am not using in this container. I chose the hot-pink one so I could see it easily in the back of my closet when I need to get it out. The plastic is hard enough so that my posters won't get crushed anymore! If you want your posters to last, and you can't frame them all, I'd definitely order one of these.
customer_reviews.author: George Crangerberk

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when adjusting
customer_reviews.text: If you're not careful adjusting for height or unlocking it, you might damage your poster. Be sure to adjust when the poster is not inside of it just in case. was very nice to have when traveling to different conferences for my research.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and I would say I am pretty disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this based on the high reviews. I just opened it, and I would say I am pretty disappointed in the quality. It's a very cheap plastic, adjusting the length feels like it will break at any moment. I don't see this lasting long. I would not recommend this product, and I have had it for about 2 hours. You're better off with a cardboard tube you can buy at office depot.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for transporting large targets
customer_reviews.text: I use these to bring large law enforcement style targets to the range, I clip the tube to my range bag and roll up two dozen or so 2'x3' paper targets inside.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good tube for gaming playmats
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive tube I bought to carry one of my boardgaming playmats. It works fine for that purpose - it is extendable and fairly solid. It won't stand up to rough treatment, so I would not use it for moving or traveling long distance or in any situation where it's likely to get thrown around or crushed (like in an airplane overhead bin), but the contents should survive a bit of bouncing and bumping.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protective product!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for! This is weatherproof, lightweight, has an adjustable strap, adjustable length that I will probably never really need, a SOLID bottom (so I never have to worry about the bottom dropping out), screw on cap....what more could I possibly ask for in something that will hold my concert posters securely at various gigs? It's good to know that I can keep this on my body if needed, not worry about rain, and I'm free to jump, dance, and head bang away without crushing my precious posters! :-) I already have it covered with decals. Looks GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Gina A.

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to a lot of travel
customer_reviews.text: I have zero complaints about this poster tune. I've taken it to two conferences (one in the US and one in Australia) and it has held up perfectly. Reading some of the reviews, I was concerned I may be wasting my money on a poor product. However- if you're looking to use this for research posters, it's perfect. There is no reason to shop any further. Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great for banners
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with the tube. The picture is pretty much what you get. It's heavy plastic, but not "heavy duty" so I wouldn't go into battle with it, or anything. I'm an author, and I needed a carrying case for the banners I use at events. I'm able to wrap three X-LG banners together and they fit perfectly inside. I haven't used it yet for carrying to events, but I have a feeling it's gonna do great. I'll likely be purchasing a second one for the various pieces of my banner stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bookish Witch

customer_reviews.title: I can always find my poster tube!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my own poster tube for taking to conferences and the bright yellow really makes it stand out from all the black telescoping tubes around. I like the range of sizes so that I can collapse it for easy storage or make it huge to carry even the largest of posters. The only thing is that I wish I could write my name on the poster tube itself and not on a paper insert. If the top pops off, there goes my name and email address. Otherwise, this is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for conference travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for conference travel, or oddly dimensioned posters. Only issue is that the length setting is not secure. I had to put some black duck tape on to keep it from sliding during travel. Also, the clear cap on top cracked when I tried to remove it to place a label. Would still buy again, and recommend to other students for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Protects our Banner
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to protect our organizations banner. This is perfect, but you need to know that when rolled up to a diameter of 3 inches, it barely fits in there. It's plenty long, but the diameter will not fit anything more than 3. inches.
customer_reviews.author: archrisie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little tube! Works well for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great poster tube. It is adjustable, made of strong plastic & seems to be almost waterproof (?). I seem to get constant e-mails/inquiries from Nozlen asking how I like it. I think I've told them two or three times that it is a great product. My only real suggestion, if you could call it that is make those locking adjustments notches a little deeper so it doesn't unlock or move as much. A wider strap would be a little nicer, but it is not mandatory. A great product. Holds a table banner really really well!
customer_reviews.author: DarkSim905

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking. There's better out there.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin plastic; my poster got crushed in the overhead bin on my flight. The adjustable length is also useless, it simply doesn't hold and the tube is always either flopping out to max length or crunching down the edges of my poster. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend using this as a rod tube out in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The lock for the length does not hold securely. The pressure needed to unscrew the cap will twist the upper part of the tub,unlocking it. I am using this as a fishing rod tube and will be packing it in a checked bag so not a big problem. I would not recommend using this as a rod tube out in the open while traveling. In all fairness the item is advertised as a document tube so I am not using it for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Holtzapfel

customer_reviews.title: Light and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased to store the sails of a 6ft radio controlled sailboat that you can compete at local lakes & ponds. There are clubs that sail regularly in our area. It is very sturdy and works great !!!
customer_reviews.author: Mountainfear

customer_reviews.title: but this tube does a great job protecting posters while being quite easy to find
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble figuring out how to get the extension to stay put (rather than collapse back on itself), but this tube does a great job protecting posters while being quite easy to find. The lime green seems more like highlighter yellow in person, but makes locating my poster tube easy in amongst a pile of regular black tubes. We'll see how it holds up through time- it's traveled well to the few conferences I've taken it to so far.
customer_reviews.author: Emily H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Poster Tube
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tube to take my poster to a conference. The tube is expandable up to 40 inches and very sturdy. I hate having to carry a tube, so the strap made my life much easier. Plus, it fit nicely in the overhead luggage compartment. The only issue I had was that my university copy center prints our conference posters out at 42 inches, which was two inches longer than the tube would allow. But I was able to move the tube out two more inches and use matching colored tape the hold the center together.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Good for short term travel.
customer_reviews.text: A dermal tool would solve the edge issue which may damage posters. It has three notches to hold the telescoping tube in place. The narrow strap's thickness is close to 1/24th inch in thickness. The cap has three pieces to secure the opening and, display a cardstock notice of imporantance. The band, on the opposite end, securing this strap is adjustable in length.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Took it on a plane and it fit just fine in the overhead storage and did not warp
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transport a very large poster for a presentation in Anaheim California. Took it on a plane and it fit just fine in the overhead storage and did not warp. Poster was not bent or damaged by the tube. Once I finished the presentation, I trashed the poster and was able to compress the tube to fit in my carry on suitcase for the way back home.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Transports range targets
customer_reviews.text: I use this to transport my targets to the shooting range. It works great. It does have a sling I put over my should for transport. It does telescope to adjust to bigger items.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty C

customer_reviews.title: Very serviceable tube, good value
customer_reviews.text: I use these tubes when I move scroll paintings around. These objects are more delicate than paper and vary widely in width, so a reasonably durable and easily adjustable tube is necessary. The Nozlen tubes have performed superbly on their first outings in every respect except one: the cap that fits on one end and can accommodate a label comes loose too easily during the rigors of travel. Once that happens, the only way to identify what's inside is to take it out and look at it. The caps can be taped on, but doing so makes changing the label more difficult. All in all, the tubes are a worthy product.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this to transport my four 3-foot long poles for my photography backdrop. This thing works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamins Image PhotographyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not too big, not too small, not super strong
customer_reviews.text: This tube is great. Extendable with a shoulder strap, water resistance, light weight. It serves it's purpose well and I think over all it is a good value. I think $15 is a good price. But it is a bit flimsy. I was able to flex it easily with my hand, and even a small car would have no problem flattening whatever is inside. I was expecting something thicker, like a PVC Pipe. Also, it is hard to adjust the length. The locking mechanism is rather primitive and takes some force, which can distort the tube and damage whatever is inside, so I have to take my documents out if I need to change the length.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. This is a great device for transporting paintings, lithographs, blueprints or an other large "roll able" items. I needed to transport some expensive paintings to Russia from Chicago and it worked great packed in luggage. Easy to use and extend, you merely have to be smarter than the device Extend the strap and untwist extend and reverse twist the end to tighten to the size you choose. In fact I am bringing back some paintings from South America that just did not work in Russia on my reverse trip tomorrow. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Forest Barbieri

customer_reviews.title: I can see why this is designated as an Amazon's Choice product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and did expand perfectly (you need to loosen the shoulder strap in order to expand). I liked it so much, after I opened the package and put the posters in it, I ordered another one for the rest of our posters! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AM Mac

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this tube
customer_reviews.text: This tube was used to store/transport/fly to CO from CA with a science symposium poster. It extended well and I actually fit it diagonally in my large checked in luggage. The lid did not pop off unexpectedly wn carrying it on my shoulder and the name tag on top was very nice wn needing to find it among the others at the conference. Lid screws on and material seems sturdy (although this is my first tube). Great price when comparing to the others.
customer_reviews.author: sherbear22

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that the Nozlen Document Poster Tube was the exact product I needed. Traveling by Air, I had some posters I was taking to a friend in New Mexico and I needed something I could carry the posters in, rolled-up. I saw the Nozlen Document Poster Tube and felt from the description this product was what I needed. My posters traveled with no damage and I liked the Nozlen Document Poster Tube's ability to be extended to accommodate the size posters I was transporting. I highly recommend this product if you are looking for a Document Tube to carry and protect your documents.
customer_reviews.author: Xlsmx2

customer_reviews.title: The collegues in the office love them too
customer_reviews.text: I use the Nozlen Expanding Documents Tubes since I got them! The collegues in the office love them too! They are so easy to handle and will storage my important Posters. These tubes are well ingeneered, the best way to transport my drawings / documents on the campus while it rains I mean it poors; but just I get wet. Perfect, what else can I say. Sincerely yours
customer_reviews.author: Ulrich Schwan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for my posters
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and priced well (as of this posting). Would be a little better if there was a little padding on each end perhaps but I still give it 5 stars. Just make sure it fits the width and length of what you need (and remember the height is adjustable).
customer_reviews.author: K_E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bringing art cross-country
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product. I bought 2 of these to bring 2 Tibetan thangkas cross-country by plane. They are pretty sturdy, hard plastic and the length adjusted easily and stayed fixed. The adjustable length strap also worked well. I was concerned about getting them on the plane, so I taped the two tubes together and rearranged my carry-on luggage into the tubes and one other piece for the first flight. I went back to 3 pieces for the second flight and no one said a word when I boarded.
customer_reviews.author: A. Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Highly dissapointed. Looks a lot cheaper than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly dissapointed. Looks a lot cheaper than I expected for its price. I paid extra to have it ship to me in time for Texas Frightmare Weekend, but as soon as I opened it, it cracked. The top doesn't look very secure either. I can't imagine this holding up troughout the day at any convention, honestly. Will be returning and looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing rod tube.
customer_reviews.text: Works great !!!! One tube holds 2 fishing rods a casting rod 4 piece and a spinning rod 4 piece. Nice tub for suit case or carry on.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing not to like for what my purpose was. I play in a band and needed this to store and protect the band banners that we invested in. It was one of the better purchases we’ve made. The Nozlen company go out of their way to satisfy their clients. They went above and beyond to satisfy me when my canister took a fall down a flight of stairs and the cap broke. They were more than happy to send me a replacement one with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Garofalo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tube-folio
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size tube for your goods. I can shove 20 drawings and maps in here. All good. Extends to fit oversized drawings as well. 42" maybe. See details. Use it every day. Throw it over my shoulder and know work is clean and in order.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Great tube with 1 MAJOR drawback
customer_reviews.text: The "bump" that locks the tubes in position is pitiful. Just turning the cap unlocks it. Will put a bead of epoxy or something on it and lock it. I use it for carrying targets to the range and I only need it on it's shortest size. Great item if they would just improve the size locking.
customer_reviews.author: D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Good Tube. Could be thicker.
customer_reviews.text: Good document/print tube, but the sides will give if that unfortunate situation occurs and something heavy (i.e. someone's foot) happens to put weight on it. Alvin Ice Tubes are MUCH sturdier construction if you could potentially be in that situation but you should be protecting your investment anyway. This tube has a screw on cap which the Alvins do not. This is the feature that sold me on it as well as the expandable feature. It's a great tube for the money but be aware that it's definitely not indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I looked around a bit before picking this one and I wasn't disappointed. It is sturdy and works well. You can adjust its length. I never had any issues with it. It was also easy to use and carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: This didn't even make it to the airport.
customer_reviews.text: This item fell on my hardwood floor when taking it out of the box at home and immediately cracked around the lid and collar. Definitely would not hold up to airplane travel. I was taken in by the cute colors, but other presenters that had the beefy black tubes ended up with the win.
customer_reviews.author: teefairf

customer_reviews.title: Not 3.5" inside
customer_reviews.text: In general, the tube is sturdy and the length locking mechanism seems to work well. My only disappointment is that the inside diameter is 3"; I had hoped for the claimed 3-1/2" to allow extra room for large building plans. The label on the tube does say 3.5" outside diameter, but the Amazon listing is not clear about this. You can only come up with 3.5" if you measure the outside of label-holding cap that snaps over the top of the screw on cap.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great tube. I used this to insert a poster for a conference and I took it from Los Angeles to Hawaii. The poster didn't get crushed, so the tube did its job and protected it. Also, it rained upon arrival in Hawaii so it also kept our poster dry as well. Overall great quality tube, it didn't damage our poster at all rather just did a good job of protecting it. Also, I love the pink color, and I love how it can extend if you need it to be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Alix P.

customer_reviews.title: Poster tube
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take with me to Star Wars celebration Chicago. Only downside it holds one poster in the tube!
customer_reviews.author: dan bauman

customer_reviews.title: Great product... very happy
customer_reviews.text: The tube arrived a day early. The mailman left the box on our porch in the pouring rain, where it stayed for hours. The box, which was quite thick, was soaked and falling apart... but the tube inside was shrink wrapped and perfectly dry!!!! Very pleased with the seller and the product. PS in its first week it has already survived a multi-stop trip to Hawaii and walking to and from the convention center during Hurricane/tropical storm Ana!! Posters inside were dry and protected!
customer_reviews.author: Anna P.

customer_reviews.title: Nozlen quality
customer_reviews.text: This is second review, as the first was for the large tube some years ago. These smaller tubes are exactly as expected...Nozlen quality, adjustability, and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Dobie

customer_reviews.title: Great map tube with even better service
customer_reviews.text: Great map tube with even better service. Nolzen followed up with me after the purchase with out me going to them, I had an issue where the strap broke after my first use. I was a little irritated but when I looked there was an email asking for feedback. I told them the issue, they apologized right away and the sent a replacement no questions asked. No issues since then and I have used every week since.
customer_reviews.author: C. Steinhoff

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit thick, but maybe that's right for you.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for light use. The locking/positioning system seems a little too soft for heavier use as it could come undone with too much twisting force in the wrong direction. Worked well for the comic expo I took it to but it might have been a little thick after seeing a different tube someone else had. I would still recommend to anyone looking for a decent tube.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, and works well. I have yet to actually test it with artwork, because I got it early and don't have to carry all my artwork around yet. The only thing I dislike a bit is the fact that if you push on the top or bottom of the tube too much when it's extended, it shrinks back because of the flexibility of the plastic. It's a bit hard to explain, but basically when you push on it, because the tube can be squished and such, the notches end up moving. But since the plastic flexibility was created to make the tube not shatter when it falls, the notches moving when pushed too hard can't be helped.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Smolnikov

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: It was as I expected it in appearance and in extension. However, it would not lock properly to keep from changing lengths. I had to put fiber tape around the diameter of where it was supposed to lock to keep it from slipping to a shorter length and thereby damaging the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Houstonstudent

customer_reviews.title: - Easily fits two full-size scientific posters (probably could fit a ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to carry scientific posters at conferences. Pros: - Easily fits two full-size scientific posters (probably could fit a 3rd) - Long strap - Adjustable length Cons: - Main one is that the interlocking halves don't stay locked. I had to tape them with packaging tape to make sure they didn't unlock, which looked ridiculous. - poster sometimes gets caught on the lid of the tube, making it hard to get the poster out and scruffing up the edges in the process Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, reasonably priced and great for protecting artwork ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, reasonably priced and great for protecting artwork while traveling. I used this tube to bring back several purchases I made at New York Comic Con. Saved me a bundle on shipping plus I was able to personally see to it that my art was handled properly and not crushed. I put a bunch of stickers on the outside of my tube for identification, just in case someone else might otherwise get confused as to who owns this tube.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: As a tube for carrying conference posters, it's good. You can collapse it to the length of the poster (almost), making it easier to carry. It's adequately strong. On the way back from a far-away conference, I decided to check it as luggage. (In the past I have shipped myself posters in cardboard tubes, and they would arrive mangled.) In the process the cap got ripped entirely off. The rest of the tube and the poster inside were fine. I wrote to Nozlen asking if I could buy just the cap, and they sent me one for free. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Chartrand

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for maps
customer_reviews.text: I run a D&D campaign and make my own large-format maps. This is the perfect way to get those maps to and from games, and protect them in general. I especially like the fact that this tube telescopes, so it accommodates a wide variety of map sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction - Thoughtful Design!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Exceeds expectations! As a former military person and a heavy business traveller, when I shop for things I will be taking on the road with me I look for sturdy construction and thoughtful design. This product met and exceeded my expectations. What prompted this purchase was a family trip to Europe with the kids and we needed a super strong, yet adaptable art tube to bring back all our museum poster booty. Let me put it this way, this thing is tough enough that I feel comfortable slinging it across the back of my sweet but somewhat absent-minded 7-year old's back and NOT BE WORRIED about whether what's inside might get damaged. Very, very pleased by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo V.

customer_reviews.title: good poster tube
customer_reviews.text: The poster tube is sturdy. It has a thoughtful lock feature, but the lock is a bit loose.
customer_reviews.author: lalala

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Nozlen poster tube
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Nozlen poster tube! Sturdy! Lightweight and protected my delicate paper poster all the way across the country and 3 airplane rides! Poster arrived in top shape. Then collapsed the Nozlen tube and just put it into my large suitcase for the return trip home. Couldn't have worked better! One tip: I used some package tape to more securely lock the tube, once I had the proper length for my poster). Love the Nozlen tube and highly recommend it! five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke
customer_reviews.text: I only wish it was more durable. It fell over and the plastic part that holds the strap on the tube broke the first time I had to travel with it. Now I just have taped it on there because I don't have a better solution. Not sure how well it's going to work out. But if I bought another, it would happen again. It just makes it kind of a pain to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great would recommend
customer_reviews.text: the tube itself is awesome used it for a convention this past weekend and it was so handy although tightening the tube sometimes messed with the locking mechanic causing it to unlock but it was easy enough to fix
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Protects Presentations Very Well
customer_reviews.text: This poster tube is exactly what we needed to transport posters for presentation at technical conferences. It easily holds a 3' by 4' poster along with a package of velcro fasteners and an envelope for business cards; everything we need for presentations. It fits in airline overhead compartments and the carrying strap makes it easy to tote. The only complaint is that the clear cap that provides a spot for an ID cracked when the tube was checked as luggage. The tube itself came through just fine, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Service a Plus!
customer_reviews.text: This, of course, was a fantastic product and the fact that it is adjustable to size was a huge plus as we transport award tapestries around the country for honors functions. But above that, there was a little bit of a shipping snafu that damaged one of the containers (not on the part of the seller) and the service to get us taken care of was above and beyond! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Faithful Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After 1 use the strap is already coming apart. Not worth the quality. And it was only 1 poster in it The strap itself is rolled and not done properly. There is no way to get it straight. Don't buy this
customer_reviews.author: satyanam

customer_reviews.title: The poster tube is great. I took it with me to a three-night ...
customer_reviews.text: The poster tube is great. I took it with me to a three-night stand of DMB concerts at the Gorge in Washington this past weekend for Labor Day. I'm on the East Coast, so this tube traveled on my back for the flights out and back and came with me into the pit for the first night of the three shows. I'd personally like it to be a little wider diameter, but it fit four posters snugly with craft paper and kept them safe. I was a little nervous about the "ridge" inside because it's expandable, but I didn't have any trouble. I suppose the craft paper helped. All in all, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Hanscom

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It would be perfect but... I dislike the fact that every time i twist the cap to close it, it unlocks towards the same way and i have to check again if the tube is not locked in.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Z.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, professional looking
customer_reviews.text: Its perfect. It extends further than I anticipated, even though I knew it expanded to 40". That is by far long enough for any poster I have or would need (student/parent/wife). Its made of really strong plastic, and has a nice top piece you can put a name tag in, or remove it if not needed. Looks great as well. Professional and sleek, even though it's plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: useful but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Meant for use with very light items. The plastic broke off TWICE (they sent me replacements). I keep a roll of plastic tablecloths in it for my art classes that I travel to at bars (Its nice to be able to carry it on my shoulder). I used duct tape to fix black plastic part that holds the strap and now it works great (I use it 5 nights a week).
customer_reviews.author: DailyAmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: The tube does have some weight but it's very sturdy. I'm glad that I bought it in advance ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for moving to protect my wall posters and paintings. I put three inside but there was definitely some space left for few more. The tube does have some weight but it's very sturdy. I'm glad that I bought it in advance because when I first opened it there was a strong smell and I had to air it out for couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Movie One Sheets
customer_reviews.text: I got this b/c I work for a movie studio and anytime a film releases we get one of the one sheets/posters. I wanted something that I could store them in while they weren't being displayed. This worked perfectly. I adjusted it to the correct size and was able to fit my 2 posters in very easily. Also the communication from Nozlen has been really good. One note- you must adjust the shoulder strap to adjust the length of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: -j

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs but be cautious
customer_reviews.text: This is a great poster tube. The only problem I have with it, is that when you tighten the lid, you can also unlatch it when it’s expanded. That could be a major problem if it collapses with your item inside and falls on it
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Convienient
customer_reviews.text: My wife travels for work and had been carrying a card board tube under an arm while dealing with luggage. It sure appeared to be a pain. This adjustable tube with a strap sure made her traveling a lot easier. It is stout but, would probably crush if a suitcase was dropped on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Solid protection for your poster or drawings
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a recent trip, became one of the cool guys carrying a mysterious black tube through the airport :-) Seriously, though, the tube is well made, provides sturdy protection for the conference poster I was carrying. I like the fact that length of tube is adjustable to accommodate different poster sizes. Screw-on end closes the tube securely.
customer_reviews.author: Steve_C

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, breaks very easily--even came broken!
customer_reviews.text: The black plastic portion was broken into tiny tiny pieces upon arrival, although the shipping box was fine. Very flimsy. Not sure how well it would hold up with traveling. Could easily be broken in an overheard compartment on a plane! Returning immediately and buying a different poster tube. (Although I loved the pink color!)
customer_reviews.author: Rory A.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy & reliable tube that I bought to carry ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy & reliable tube that I bought to carry posters around a convention. Excellent value for the price, my only knock & the reason this product doesn’t get a 5 star rating would be the locking mechanism isn’t super sturdy so if you’re not careful it could easily loosen & damage your stuff. Of course I was cautious & didn’t have this happen but it was something that I noticed. When wearing it with the strap over your shoulder you’re less likely to have this happen but if you decide to carry in your hand that possibly of it loosening goes up. All in all I’d recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tube - if you still have bristol sheets
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who still need to haul around Bristol sheets, this one is a great choice. It is sturdy enough and expandable up to any imaginable size, and unlike some others it can be fixed on any level of extension - so it does not rely on paper to keep its length. And you can open the cup that covers manufacturer's name and actually turn the piece of paper around and write what exactly you are storing in the tube - nice touch!
customer_reviews.author: Guenter Page

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and the adjustable strap is great for wearing on your back
customer_reviews.text: The expandable size doesn't lock in well, but nothing some tape can't fix. Solid construction and the adjustable strap is great for wearing on your back.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: PROS: - The cylinder is very durable - strong ...
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - The cylinder is very durable - strong plastic - not flimsy CONS: - expandable piece is difficult to lock and does not stay in place. (crushed my posters at a recent show) I had to hold it or stand it up the entire time. - Strap is short and not very adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow

customer_reviews.title: I like that the tube itself is very sturdy and has ...
customer_reviews.text: I use my Nozlen tube for my drafting papers and floorplans for school. I like that the tube itself is very sturdy and has done well during light rain. The strap definitely makes it easier to carry on bart, but the material could improe/be more comfy & supporting. I find that because it's easily adjustable, it will sometimes do so itself and crinkle the bottoms of my papers.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, functional and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for an interior design student. Sturdy, inexpensive, looks professional. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great with one minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this tube for storing long implements used in winemaking: my oxygen injector wand, thief, and racking cane. It works splendidly and fits all of them. My only complaint is that it's easy to undo the length lock while unscrewing the cap, and so you have to hold it by the upper portion nearer the cap to avoid accidentally extending it and having it slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Demitri

customer_reviews.title: Not just for paper
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to hold my modular Manfrotto boom arms. Because they have hollow ends I didn't want them crushed during airline shipping. The tube is well made and the notches which allow you to adjust the size of the tube lock in a positive manner. The strap adjusts as well and the opening end is a screw type fastener which is very positive. I'd highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kitaoka

customer_reviews.title: Water /loose cap
customer_reviews.text: Great wish there was a a water proof option for the bad days and the cap falls off very easily instead of screwing it on you can just press on it, need less flexiable cover
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Mexico may make you check this as baggage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a carry on fishing rod holder while in Mexico, but Alaska airlines made me check it as baggage. It is not of acceptable construction for checked baggage.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Schatzel

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. Protects my bad art.
customer_reviews.text: Much nicer than the cheaper tube I owned before. Solid construction. My only wish is that the tube locked into position in a more fixed way. I still use some tape to ensure that the tube doesn't twist somehow and unlock from the desired length.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Barker

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Very Easy to Adjust to Desired Size
customer_reviews.text: This tube is easy to adjust to the size desired. It has a screw on lid while most are brands have pop off lids. This one is much more secure. It is light weight but seems durable. A very nice carrying strap which can be adjusted to desirable length. I am using it to store a 6' by 3' banner and love I can make it the exact length that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor D.

customer_reviews.title: well made poster tube
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made poster tube. It's made of plastic and is adjustable. The plastic seems durable enough. And the method for adjusting how long the tube is (to accomodate different sized posters) is very easy to adjust. Having the strap is helpful for the purpose of carrying it. And the cap helps ensure that the poster stays in place in the tube. Overall I'd say that this exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E.

product_meta.title: Nozlen Document Poster Tube - Black Plastic Storage Tube Expands from 24.5" up to 40" with Clear ID Card Cap - Water and Light Resistant - Telescoping for Posters, Artwork and Drawings Model DT3001
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:1 PackThe Nozlen Expanding Document Tube Model DT3001 expands from 24.5" to 40" with 21 adjustable locking positions in 3/4" increments. This Black tube now has a longer shoulder strap. The strap is long enough to use even when the poster tube is fully extended. This telescoping tube is great for poster collectors, artists, draftsman, use on job sites, for students and professionals. The screw on end cap makes storing and removing documents very simple. The removable lid cap allows you to store your contact information or tube storage details for easy identification. The screw on cap with a tight seal makes the Nozlen Document Tube both water and light resistant. This tube is made out of a very durable plastic, and is not "flimsy" in any way. The document tube is perfect for posters, art work, drawings, blueprints, maps, arrows, large photos, vintage posters, etc.
feature_bullets: Affordable, Black Plastic Telescoping Document Poster Tube with 3.5" diameter that expands from 24.5" up to 40" is ideal for artists, architects, and poster collectors

Poster Tube is made of a very rigid plastic to protect contents from bending or creasing in transit. Tube is also water and light resistant, protects materials against fading from exposure to sun light
Now includes an Extra Long Shoulder Strap that is comfortable for use even when the tube is fully extended
Twist off, threaded lid with contact card for easy labeling of tube's contents
Storage tube has unlimited uses, such as storage for: posters, blue prints, maps, documents, large photo prints, drawings, artwork, arrows, fishing rods, drum sticks, or whatever else you can imagine

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars804 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
